description.narrative: The project development objectives (PDOs) of the TAMP are to assist the General Department of Taxation (GDT) to strengthen governance in tax administration and to increase the level of voluntary compliance with the tax system by improving the effectiveness, efficiency, transparency and accountability of the tax administration. The project will have a positive impact on the investment climateby building predictable and enforceable tax administration processes and procedures. The sustainability ofrevenue collection will also be supported through implementation of this project. The PDOs therefore are complementary to two higher level objectives of thecountry's four reform pillars, namely business led development, and strengthened governance systems.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section I. 4 | Description :Engagement of an ICT expert with international experience and TORsacceptable to IDA. | Due Date :30-Jun-2011
Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section I. 4 | Description :Establishment at GDT, and thereafter mainternance, of an internal auditfunction in respect of the Project. | Due Date :31-Dec-2008
Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section V. 1 | Description :Provision of a comprehensive anti-corruption strategy in taxadministration for IDA's review and comments. | Due Date :06-Oct-2009
Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section V. 1 | Description :Provision of a strategy for managing organizational changes for IDA'sreview and comments | Due Date :30-Sep-2009

Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section V. 1 | Description :Provision of an annual plan of Project activities for the followingcalendar year, together with the estimated budget therefor fromall sources, for IDA's review and comments. | Due Date :31-Oct-2008

Finance Agreement :Schedule II, Section V. 1 | Description :Put into effect throughout the Department of such core businessprocesses as shall have been revised and re-engineered under the Project. | Due Date :01-Dec-2010

title.narrative: Perception of the integrity of staff as measured by periodic internal and external stakeholder surveys.
Component 2: Operational Development.Percentage of taxpayers filing electronically.

baseline.value: 1,899,599 of which- 270,664 enterprises,- 1,628, 972 business households, - 400,000 personal income taxpayers.

title.narrative: Component 1: Institutional Development.Perception of managers and staff regarding the level of professional skills in selected functional areas
Component 2: Operational Development.Additional tax collected as a result of tax audits/ Additional tax assessed through tax audits.
Component 2: Operational DevelopmentPercentage of written queries answered within 30 days
Tax arrear by year end / total tax arrear collected duing the year
Component 2: Operational Development.Average time required to settle administrative disputes.
Public perception of the quality of tax administration performance as measured by periodic surveys.
Tax revenues paid voluntarily/ total tax revenues collected.
Component 2: Operational Development.Percentage of tax audits resulting in additional tax assessments.
Component 2: Operational DevelopmentPerception of taxpayers regarding the quality of services provided by the tax administration.
Component 2: Operational Development.Average time taken to process a VAT refund request.
Component 1: Institutional Development.Turnover ratios in key areas such as IT, tax audit and legal.
Component 3: IT Development.Improved computer and networking hardware & systems software.
Component 3: IT Development.Improved data integrity (provide complete, reliable and & timely data) about taxpayers.
Component 3: IT Development.A configurable, maintainable ITAIS that can continue to provide effective support of tax administration in the future.
Component 3: IT Development.Best practices model embedded in/ supported by ITAIS.
Component 3: IT Development.Common integrated system across all taxes rather than a variety of software used for different taxes.
Component 4: Project ManagementProcurement and FM carried out in a timely manner and in accordance with the World Bank guidelines.
Component 4: Project ManagementProject audits and procurement and financial supervision reports produced in uniformly good quality.
Component 4: Project ManagementProject progress and financial reports are submitted in a timely manner.
Component 4: Project ManagementChange management strategies developed and on-going participation of staff and managements in change process facilitated.
Compliance by major taxes: VAT, CIT, and PIT.

target.value: VAT tax return: 90%; Quarterly CIT Return: 85%; Finalization Yearly CIT Return: 60%; PIT Tax return: 50%
